newsitem.title: UK: Union urges end to redundancies at Lloyds.
newsitem.headline: Union urges end to redundancies at Lloyds.

text.p: UK finance trade union BIFU on Monday urged British politicians to stop compulsory redundancies at Lloyds-TSB and force the merged bank to consult customers before it closes high street branches.
The union said it was writing to members of parliament (MPs) and peers, asking them to make amendments to a bill relating to the 1995 merger between Lloyds Bank and TSB Group.
"We believe 10,000 jobs and at least 650 branches are at risk," the union said.
It added that about 1,000 jobs had already been cut or were about to be cut in Lloyds-TSB through the merger of some head office functions.
Although the merger took effect late in 1995, Lloyds needed an act of parliament to enable it to merge the accounts of customers at the two banks.
The bill was due to be debated early in 1997, BIFU said in a statement.
